-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Make more than one point in numeric literals
--   
--   Allows use to write more pointful than usual numbers. Example:
--   <tt>3.14.159</tt>.
--   
--   This is very useful for various obvious undisclosed reasons.
@package acme-pointful-numbers
@version 0.1.2.4


-- | This module allows you to make more points in your numbers
--   
--   <pre>
--   import Prelude hiding ((.))
--   import Acme.Pointful       -- re-exports Control.Category's (.)
--   
--   
--   ghc, ip ∷ Pointful
--   
--   ghc = 7.8.2                -- ≡ Pointful [7,8,2]
--   ip  = 192.168.100.1
--   </pre>
--   
--   It won't work with big numbers (and it won't even try to prevent
--   incorrect results). Up to 7 digits is ok.
--   
--   Don't use if your code is not pointless enough.
--   
--   Don't use if you care about the trailing zeros (in all the parts after
--   first point). They may be insignificant. Sometimes.
module Acme.Pointful
type Pointful = () + ((), ())

-- | the identity morphism
id :: Category cat => forall a. cat a a

-- | morphism composition
(.) :: Category cat => forall b c a. cat b c -> cat a b -> cat a c
instance Show (Chuwabra a b)
instance Num (Chuwabra a b) => Fractional (Chuwabra a b)
instance Category Chuwabra
instance Num (Chuwabra a b)
